summary.p: This bundle (35-3027 palm leaf manuscript) contains three texts. The first one is the Śrīmadbhagavadgītā of Vedavyāsa; the second one is a collection of 8 Stotra-s of Śaṅkarācārya, and the Śivakavacastotra from the Skāndapurāṇa; and the third one is the Sāmudrikalakṣaṇa from the Bṛhannāradīyapurāṇa of Vedavyāsa, in Telugu script.

The first text is the Śrīmadbhagavadgītā of Vedavyāsa. The Śrīmadbhagavadgītā is a part of the epic Mahābhārata Bīṣma Parva, it contains 18 adhyāya-s and 700 verses. The Bhagavadgītā is the best known and most famous of Hindu texts. The Gītā is set in a narrative framework of a dialogue between the Pāṇdava prince Arjuna and his guide and charioteer Śrīkṛṣṇa. The Kṛṣṇa and Arjuna dialogues cover a broad range of spiritual topics, touching upon ethical dilemmas and philosophical issues that go far beyond the war Arjuna faces. The Bhagavadgītā presents a synthesis of Hindu ideas about dharma, theistic bhakti, and the yogic ideals of mokṣa. The text covers jñāna, bhakti, karma, incorporating ideas from Sāmkhyayoga philosophy.

The second one is a collection of 8 Stotra-s of Śaṅkarācārya, as well as the Śivakavacastotra from the Skāndapurāṇa. Stotra-s are a type of popular devotional literature. A stotra can be a prayer, a description, or a conversation, but always with a poetic structure. It may be a simple poem expressing praise and personal devotion to a deity. Many stotra hymns praise aspects of the divine, such as Devī, Śiva, or Viṣṇu. Though the majority of Śrīśaṅkarācārya's works concentrate on Advaita, he equally preaches on bhakti since he believed that bhakti is a very essential step for Cittaśuddhi. Hence he composed verses and hymns in praise of every lord, the majority of which were concentrated on Viṣṇu, Śiva, and Śakti. He wanted the people to worship the lord in any form of their wish, the results of which must finally purify their mind and make it fit for self-realization. The list of the stotra-s in this manuscript are:
Catuḥślokīstotra,
Pañcaratnastotra,
Nirvāṇadaśakastotra,
Kaupīnapañcakastotra,
Upadeśapañcakastotra,
Mānasapūjāpañcakastotra,
Jīvabrahmaikastotra,
Śukāṣṭaka,
Catuḥślokī [B],
Praśnottararatnamālikāstotra,
Śivakavacastotra from the Skāndapurāṇa, and
Dvādaśajyotirliṅgastotra.

The third one is the Sāmudrikalakṣaṇa from the Bṛhannāradīyapurāṇa of Vedavyāsa. The Sāmudrikalakṣaṇa is the knowledge of body features and the study of face reading, often used in Vedic astrology, as it is related to astrology and palmistry. The tradition assumes that every natural or acquired bodily mark encodes its owner's psychology and destiny. Elevation, depression, elongation, diminution, and other marks become relevant.

msItem.title: Śrīmadbhagavadgītā
msItem.author: Vedavyāsa
msItem.incipit: bhagavadgītā likhyate| dhṛtarāṣṭra uvāca| dharmakṣetre kurukṣetre samavetā yuyutsavaḥ| māmakāḥ pāṇḍavāścaiva kimakurvata saṃjaya| śajaya uvāca| dṛṣṭvā tu pāṇḍavānīkaṃ vyūḍhaṃ duryodhanastadā| ācāryamupasaṃgamya rājā vacanamabravīt|
msItem.explicit: gītāśāstramidaṃ puṇyaṃ yaḥ paṭhetsatataṃ naraḥ| viṣṇoḥ padamavāpnoti bhayaśokavivarjitaḥ| sarvataḥ pratigṛhṇāno bhuñjāno nyāyatastataḥ| ghoraṃ vaivasvataṃ sthānaṃ gītādhyāyī na paśyati|
msItem.finalRubric: oṃ tatsaditi śrīmahābhārate śatasāhasrikāyāṃ saṃhitāyāṃ vaiyaisakyāṃ bhīṣmaparvaṇi śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrakṛṣṇārjunasaṃvāde sakalaśāstraparamārthanirṇayamokṣanyāsayogo nāma aṣṭādaśo'dhyāyaḥ|
msItem.colophon: śubhakṛdvatsare jyeṣṭhaśubhavāsare likhitā bhagavadgītā| śrīkeśavāya namaḥ|

msItem.title: Catuḥślokīstotra
msItem.author: Śaṅkarācārya
msItem.explicit: brahmaivāhaṃ na saṃsārī mukto'hamiti bhāvayet| aśaknuvan bhāvayituṃ vākyametadudīrayet| vākyābhyasanamātreṇa jīvanmukto na saṃśayaḥ|

msItem.title: Pañcaratnastotra
msItem.author: Śaṅkarācārya
msItem.incipit: nāhaṃ deho nendriyāṇyantaraṅgo nāhaṅkāro praṇavargo na buddhiḥ| dārāpatyakṣetravittādidūraḥ sākṣī nityaḥ pratyagātmā śivo'ham|
msItem.explicit: matto nānyatkiñcidatrāsti viśvaṃ satyaṃ bāhyaṃ vastu māyopakluptam| ādarśāntarbhāsamānāsya tulyaṃ mayyadvaite bhāti tasmācchivo'ham|

msItem.title: Nirvāṇadaśakastotra
msItem.author: Śaṅkarācārya
msItem.incipit: na bhūmirna toyaṃ na tejo na vāyuḥ na khaṃ nendriyaṃ vā na teṣāṃ samūhaḥ| anaikāntikatvātsuṣuptyaikasiddhastadeko'vaśiṣṭaḥ śivaḥ kevalo'ham|
msItem.explicit: na caikaṃ tadanyaddvitīyaṃ kutaḥ syānna cākevalatvaṃ na vā kevalatvam| na śūnyaṃ na cāśūnyamadvaitakatvātkathaṃ sarvavedāntasiddhaṃ bravīmi|

msItem.title: Kaupīnapañcakastotra
msItem.author: Śaṅkarācārya
msItem.incipit: vedāntavākyeṣu sadā ramanto bhikṣānnamātreṇa ca tuṣṭimantaḥ| viśokamantaḥkaraṇe ramantaḥ kaupīnavantaḥ khalu bhāgyavantaḥ|
msItem.explicit: pañcākṣaraṃ pāvanamuccarantaḥ patiṃ paśūnāṃ hṛdi bhāvayantaḥ| bhikṣāśino dikṣu paribhramantaḥ kaupīnavantaḥ khalu bhāgyavantaḥ|

msItem.title: Upadeśapañcakastotra
msItem.author: Śaṅkarācārya
msItem.incipit: vedo nityamadhīyatāṃ taduditaṃ karma svanuṣṭhīyatāṃ| teneśasya vidhīyatāmapacitiḥ kāmye matistyājyatām| pāpaughaḥ paribhūyatāṃ bhavasukhe doṣo'nusaṃdhīyatā| mātmecchā vyavasīyatāṃ nijagṛhātūrṇaṃ vinirgamyatām|
msItem.explicit: yaḥ ślokapañcakamidaṃ paṭhate manuṣyaḥ saṃcintayatyanudinaṃ| Sthiratāmupetya tasyāśu saṃsṛtidavānalatīvraghoratāpaḥ praśāntimupayāti citiprasādāt|

msItem.title: Mānasapūjāpañcakastotra
msItem.author: Śaṅkarācārya
msItem.incipit: ārādhayāmi maṇisaṃsthitamātmaliṅgaṃ māyāpurīhṛdayapaṅkajasaṃniviṣṭam| śraddhānadīvimalacittajalābhiṣekaiḥ nityaṃ samādhikusumairna punarbhavāya|
msItem.explicit: ātmā tvaṃ kamalā matiḥ parijanāḥ prāṇāḥ śarīrī gṛhaṃ| pūjā te viṣayopabhogaracanā nidrā samādhisthitiḥ| saṃcāraḥ padayoḥ pradakṣiṇavidhiḥ stotrāṇi sarvā giraḥ| yadyatkarma karomi tattadakhilaṃ viṣṇo tavārādhanam|

msItem.title: Jīvabrahmaikastotra
msItem.author: Śaṅkarācārya
msItem.incipit: natvācāryātmānaṃ śrīśaṃ matvā jīvabrahmaikatvaṃ hṛdyāmadvaitasvārājye tadbrahmāhaṃ mohātītam| yatra svāntenātibhrāntyā viśvaṃ nānārūpaṃ bhāti abdhau yatsvanormyadi|
msItem.explicit: jīvabrahmaikatvakhyātigranthe cittaṃ yaḥ saṃdhatte hitvā mohaṃ vītakleśaḥ saṃprāpnoti brahmaikatvam|

msItem.title: Praśnottararatnamālikāstotra
msItem.author: Śaṅkarācārya
msItem.incipit: kaḥ khalu nālaṅkriyatedṛṣṭādṛṣṭārthasādhanapaṭīyām| amuyā kaṇṭhasthitayā praśnottararatnamālikayā|
msItem.explicit: phalamapi bhagavadbhakteḥ kiṃ tallokasākṣāttvam.mokṣaśca ko hyavidyāstamayaḥkaḥsarvavedabhaḥ atharcī| ityeṣā kaṇṭhasthā praśnottararatnamālikā yeṣām| te muktābharaṇā iva vimalāścābhānti satsamāneṣu|

msItem.title: Śivakavacastotra
msItem.author: Vedavyāsa
msItem.incipit: om asya śrīśivakavacastotramahāmantrasya ṛṣabhayogīśvara ṛṣiḥ. anuṣṭubh chandaḥ| śrīsadāśivarudro devatā| hrīṃ śaktiḥ raṃ kīlakam| śrīṃ hrīṃ klīṃ bījam. sadāśivaprītyarthe śivakavacastotrajape viniyogaḥ. oṃ namo bhagavate jvalajjvālāmāline| oṃ hrīṃ rāṃ sarvaśaktidhāmne īśānātmane aṅguṣṭhābhyāṃ namaḥ|
msItem.explicit: bhasmadhāraṇasāmarthyācchatrusainyaṃ vijeṣyasi| prāpya siṃhāsanaṃ pitryaṃ goptāsi pṛthivīmimām| iti bhadrāyuṣaṃ samyaganuśāsya samātṛkam| tābhyāṃ saṃpūjitaḥ so'tha yogī svairagatiryayau|
msItem.finalRubric: iti śrīskāndapurāṇe brahmottarakhaṇḍe śrīśivakavacastotraprabhāvavarṇanaṃ nāma dvādaśo'dhyāyaḥ|

msItem.title: Sāmudrikalakṣaṇa
msItem.author: Vedavyāsa
msItem.incipit: sāmudrikaṃ pravakṣyāmi lakṣaṇaṃ puruṣastriyoḥ| pūrvamāyuḥ parīkṣeta paścāllakṣaṇamācaret| āyuhīnanarāṇāṃ tu lakṣaṇaiḥ kiṃ prayojanam| vāmabhāge tu nārīṇā dakṣiṇe puruṣasya ca|
msItem.explicit: saṃkṣepeṇa mayā proktaṃ śṛṇu rāghava rājasam| asvedaṃ cālparomaṃ ca svalpanidrālpabhojanam. kāpaṭyaṃ krauryamudvegaṃ kāmodrekaṃ manaḥ kaṭu| varjayitvā svabhāvena vartatāṃ tāṃśca yoṣiti| sā nārī subhagā jñeyā tadanyā durbhagā smṛtā| iti saṃcitya kuśalo vartatāṃ ca yathāsukham|
msItem.colophon: śrīkeśavāya namaḥ| nārāyaṇāya namaḥ| mādhavāya namaḥ| govindāya namaḥ| viṣṇave namaḥ| madhusūdanāya namaḥ| trivikramāya namaḥ| vāmanāya namaḥ| dharāya namaḥ| hṛṣīkeśāya namaḥ| padmanābhāya namaḥ| dāmodarāya namaḥ| saṃkarṣaṇāya namaḥ| vāsudevāya namaḥ| pradyumnāya namaḥ| aniruddhāya namaḥ| puruṣottamāya namaḥ| adhokṣajāya namaḥ| nārasiṃhāya namaḥ| acyutāya namaḥ| janārdanāya namaḥ| upendrāya namaḥ| haraye namaḥ| śrīkṛṣṇāya namaḥ|. sarvaṃ śrīnārāyaṇārpaṇamastu|
